fields.name: providerRecordID
fields.title: Provider Record ID
fields.description: The unique (within provider) identifier allocated to this record by the data provider e.g. when data is provided by an aggregator. It connects the record to the collection and storage of the specimens when these parts of the workflow may have been done by different parties.

fields.name: providerRecordIDSource
fields.title: Provider Record ID Source
fields.description: Person or Organisation that generated the providerRecordID. For providers registered with the BDR, this field should contain your BDR registrationID. Populate only if the details are different from the dataset submission details.

fields.name: locality
fields.title: Locality
fields.description: The specific description of the place.

fields.name: decimalLatitude
fields.title: Decimal Latitude
fields.description: The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic centre of a Location. Positive values are north of the Equator, negative values are south of it. Valid coordinate ranges for the BDR system are within and inclusive of -90 to 0.

fields.name: decimalLongitude
fields.title: Decimal Longitude
fields.description: The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic centre of a Location. Positive values are east of the Greenwich Meridian, negative values are west of it. Valid coordinate ranges for the BDR system are within and inclusive of 0 to 180.

fields.name: geodeticDatum
fields.title: Geodetic Datum
fields.description: The acronym for the ellipsoid, geodetic datum, or spatial reference system (SRS) upon which the geographic (non-projected) coordinates given in decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude as based.

fields.name: coordinateUncertaintyInMeters
fields.title: Coordinate Uncertainty In Meters
fields.description: The horizontal distance (in metres) from the given decimalLatitude and decimalLongitude describing the smallest circle containing the whole of the Location. Leave the value empty if the uncertainty is unknown, cannot be estimated, or is not applicable (because there are no coordinates). Zero is not a valid value for this term.

fields.name: dataGeneralizations
fields.title: Data Generalizations
fields.description: Actions taken to make the shared data less specific or complete than in its original form, due to restrictions around identifying locations of particular species. Suggests that alternative data of higher quality may be available on request.
fields.example: Coordinates rounded to the nearest 10 km for conservation concern

fields.name: eventDate
fields.title: Event Date
fields.description: The date (with precision of year (YYYY), month year (YYYY-MM) or date in the following formats DD/MM/YYYY or YYYY-MM-DD are accepted) or date-time without timezone (in ISO 8601 format for example 2021-07-11T06:23:00) or date-time with timezone(in ISO 8601 format for example 2022-05-20T06:23:00+08:00) during which a species occurrence was observed. For occurrences, this is the date-time when the event was recorded. Not suitable for a time in a geological context

fields.name: samplingProtocol
fields.title: Sampling Protocol
fields.description:
The sampling protocol is the method used to sample the locality to determine the presence (or absence) of the taxon referred to in this record at the indicated time. This may be a collecting method or a method to observe an organism without collection.
Recommended best practice is to describe a species occurrence with no more than one sampling protocol. In the case of a summary, in which a specific protocol can not be attributed to specific species occurrences, the recommended best practice is to repeat the property for each IRI that denotes a different sampling protocol that applies to the occurrence.

fields.name: basisOfRecord
fields.title: Basis Of Record
fields.description: The specific nature of the data record.

fields.name: recordedBy
fields.title: Recorded By
fields.description: A person, group, or organisation responsible for recording the original Occurrence.
fields.example: Stream Environment and Water Pty Ltd

fields.name: recordNumber
fields.title: Record Number
fields.description: An identifier given to the Occurrence at the time it was recorded. Often serves as a link between field notes and an Occurrence record, such as a specimen collector's number.

fields.name: occurrenceStatus
fields.title: Occurrence Status
fields.description: A statement about the presence or absence of a Taxon at a Location.

fields.name: habitat
fields.title: Habitat
fields.description: A category or description of the habitat in which the event occurred.
fields.example: Closed forest of Melaleuca lanceolata. White, grey or brown sand, sandy loam.

fields.name: establishmentMeans
fields.title: Establishment Means
fields.description: Statement about whether an organism or organisms have been introduced to a given place and time through the direct or indirect activity of modern humans.

fields.name: organismRemarks
fields.title: Organism Remarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about the Organism instance.

fields.name: individualCount
fields.title: Individual Count
fields.description: The number of individuals present at the time of the Occurrence. 0 = none, no value = the specific number was not recorded.

fields.name: organismQuantity
fields.title: Organism Quantity
fields.description: A number or enumeration value for the quantity of organisms.

fields.name: organismQuantityType
fields.title: Organism Quantity Type
fields.description: The type of quantification system used for the quantity organisms.

fields.name: lifeStage
fields.title: Life Stage
fields.description: The age class or life stage of the Organism(s) at the time the Occurrence was recorded.

fields.name: sex
fields.title: Sex
fields.description: The sex of the biological individual(s) represented in the Occurrence.

fields.name: reproductiveCondition
fields.title: Reproductive Condition
fields.description: The reproductive condition of the biological individual(s) represented in the Occurrence.

fields.name: ownerRecordID
fields.title: Owner Record ID
fields.description: Identifier given to the occurrence by the owner of the data. Populate this field if the data owner is different to the data provider. Unique (within data owner) identifier for the record.

fields.name: ownerRecordIDSource
fields.title: Owner Record ID Source
fields.description: Person or Organisation that generated the ownerRecordID. For organisations registered with the BDR, this field should contain the BDR registrationID. For all others, please provide the name of Person or Organisation who owns the data.

fields.name: collectionCode
fields.title: Collection Code
fields.description: The name, acronym, code, or initialism identifying the collection or data set from which the record was derived. It is associated with the catalogNumber.

fields.name: catalogNumber
fields.title: Catalog Number
fields.description: An identifier (preferably unique) for the record within the data set or collection.

fields.name: catalogNumberSource
fields.title: Catalog Number Source
fields.description: Organisation that generated the catalogNumber. In the BDR context, this is likely to be a collecting institution where a specimen or material sample is located. For organisations registered with the BDR, this field should contain the BDR registrationID. For all others, please provide the name of Person or Organisation.

fields.name: otherCatalogNumbers
fields.title: Other Catalog Numbers
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated with a space vertical bar space ( | )) of previous or alternate fully qualified catalog numbers or other human-used identifiers for the same Occurrence, whether in the current or any other data set or collection.

fields.name: otherCatalogNumbersSource
fields.title: Other Catalog Numbers Source
fields.description: Organisation that generated the otherCatalogNumbers. For organisations registered with the BDR, this field should contain the BDR registrationID. For all others, please provide the name of Person or Organisation.

fields.name: preparations
fields.title: Preparations
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated with a space vertical bar space ( | )) of preparations and preservation methods for a specimen.
fields.example: Wet (in ethanol or some other preservative)

fields.name: preparedDate
fields.title: Prepared Date
fields.description: The date (with precision of year (YYYY), month year (YYYY-MM) or date in the following formats DD/MM/YYYY or YYYY-MM-DD are accepted) or date-time without timezone (in ISO 8601 format for example 2021-07-11T11:23:00) or date-time with timezone(in ISO 8601 format for example 2022-05-20T06:23:00+08:00) representing the date or date-time the specimen was prepared.

fields.name: associatedSequences
fields.title: Associated Sequences
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated with a space vertical bar space ( | )) of identifiers (publication, global unique identifier, URI) of genetic sequence information associated with the Occurrence.

fields.name: sequencingMethod
fields.title: Sequencing Method
fields.description: The method used to obtain sequence data for example DNA, RNA, or protein from the sample.

fields.name: verbatimIdentification
fields.title: Verbatim Identification
fields.description: A string representing the taxonomic identification as it appeared in the original record. This term is meant to allow the capture of an unaltered original identification/determination, including identification qualifiers, hybrid formulas, uncertainties, etc. This term is meant to be used in addition to scientificName (and identificationQualifier etc.), not instead of it.

fields.name: dateIdentified
fields.title: Date Identified
fields.description: The date (with precision of year (YYYY), month year (YYYY-MM) or date in the following formats DD/MM/YYYY or YYYY-MM-DD are accepted) or date-time without timezone (in ISO 8601 format for example 2021-07-11T11:23:00) or date-time with timezone(in ISO 8601 format for example 2022-05-20T06:23:00+08:00) on which the subject was determined as representing the Taxon.

fields.name: identifiedBy
fields.title: Identified By
fields.description: Group of names, organisations who assigned the Taxon to the subject. For multiple names, use the pipe separator ( | ).
fields.example: Stream Environment and Water Pty Ltd

fields.name: identificationMethod
fields.title: Identification Method
fields.description: Method used to associate the organism with the scientificName label.

fields.name: scientificName
fields.title: Scientific Name
fields.description:
The full scientific name, with authorship and date information if known. When forming part of an Identification, this should be the name in lowest level taxonomic rank that can be determined. This term should not contain identification qualifications, which should instead be supplied in the identificationQualifier column.
NOTE: Phrase names such as Rhagodia sp. Hamersley (M.Trudgen 17794) are permitted in the scientificName field where those are in use.

fields.name: identificationQualifier
fields.title: Identification Qualifier
fields.description: A brief phrase or a standard term ("cf.", "aff.") to express the determiner's doubts about the Identification.

fields.name: identificationRemarks
fields.title: Identification Remarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about the Identification.
fields.example: DNA evidence may indicate a new species. Further analysis required.

fields.name: acceptedNameUsage
fields.title: Accepted Name Usage
fields.description: Calaendia excelsa Hopper & A.P.Br.

fields.name: kingdom
fields.title: Kingdom
fields.description: The full scientific name of the kingdom in which the taxon is classified.

fields.name: taxonRank
fields.title: Taxon Rank
fields.description: The taxonomic rank of the most specific name in the scientificName.

fields.name: threatStatus
fields.title: Threat Status
fields.description: The conservation status (or code) assigned to an organism that is recognised in conjunction with a specific jurisdiction.

fields.name: conservationJurisdiction
fields.title: Conservation Jurisdiction
fields.description: The jurisdiction under which an organism is recognised to have a specific conservation status applied.

fields.name: threatStatusCheckProtocol
fields.title: Threat Status Check Protocol
fields.description: The method used to determine if the organism is listed under the relevant jurisdictional threatened species list.
fields.example: Species name check of the Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water’s Species Profile and Threat Database http://www.environment.g ov.au/cgi-bin/sprat/public/ sprat.pl

fields.name: threatStatusDateDetermined
fields.title: Threat Status Date Determined
fields.description: The date (with precision of year (YYYY), month year (YYYY-MM) or date in the following formats DD/MM/YYYY or YYYY-MM-DD are accepted) or date-time without timezone (in ISO 8601 format for example 2021-07-11T11:23:00) or date-time with timezone(in ISO 8601 format for example 2022-05-20T06:23:00+08:00) on which this record of this organism was assigned to the nominated threatStatus and conservationJurisdiction

fields.name: threatStatusDeterminedBy
fields.title: Threat Status Determined By
fields.description: The person and/organisation responsible for appending the threatStatus and conservationJurisdiction to this organism’s occurrence record.
